result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley R Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs, WHICH ARE PAID IN FULL.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge, WHICH IS PAID IN FULL.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Bradley R Taylor
Current: N3155 County Road H, Lake Geneva, WI 53147 United States  (Effective: 01-12-2016)
Prior: 840 N. Wisconsin Street #112, Elkhorn, WI 53121
Defendant Bradley R Taylor in court with attorney Stephen M Compton.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Final pre-trial at 02-03-2016 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person at 02-08-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Bradley R Taylor in court with attorney Stephen M Compton.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Court in Session 3:08 pm. Appearances made. Defendant in court in custody with Atty Stephen Compton. ADA Rea w/ Intern A. Hahn for the State of Wisconsin. State calls first witness Roger Person who is duly sworn by clerk and upon direct examination of Ms. Hahn.
3:11 pm  - Cross exam by Atty Compton. 
3:14 pm  - Redirect by Ms. Hahn.
3:14 pm -  Evidence closed. Argument by Atty Compton. Argument by Ms. Hahn.
3:15 pm -  Court makes statement that probable cause has been found a felony has been committed. Information filed. Not guilty pleas entered. Speedy trial waived. 
3:16 pm -  Court in recess.

  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Bradley R Taylor in court, in custody with attorney Stephen M Compton.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond denied. Minutes Filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Defendant in court in custody. Atty McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.

*MUST POST $500.00 CASH* 

Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH DENA CLARK OR SARAH MCDADE.   If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
